review_title: The College is under new leadership
pros: The new president, Dr. Francis is moving the school in a much better direction than the last person to hold that office! The Faculty and Staff have bought into her mission and are excited about the future of the institution.
cons: Some of the damage caused by the last administration will take another year or so to repair.

pros: Students are the reason to work here
cons: Everything else is a battle at this struggling school

review_title: Impacting Students in a Fun Environment
pros:
-Opportunity to impact students who need it
-Programs to support student development academically and socially 
-Strong benefits package 
-Focus on work-life balance 
-Strong Promotion process
-Opportunities to increase payment by overloading, teaching seminars, and tutoring
cons:
-Salary is well below average, especially for the Boston area
-Communication between other departments
-Heavy teaching load (12-15+ credits per semester average)

pros: Passionate staff, extremely student centered, opportunity to see real changes in opportunity gap for students of color. Generous vacation time.
cons: Salary does not reflect the amount of effort needed to do the job well. Some departments have reputation for not providing employees with adequate support.

pros: The students here are great!  The mission is wonderful.  The students need a lot of support and faculty and staff can really make a difference here.
cons: The faculty are mean and heartless. The chairs and administrators go after faculty for no reason. They have their favorites and unless you are their favorite, you can forget about being respected.

pros: Strong mission to serve Boston area students, strong student support, graduates typically go on to well-paying jobs.
cons: Small, underfunded, does not really have a college culture, cliquish, key leaders are interim this and that.  Pay below average, but they ask a lot.

pros: Employees are thoroughly dedicated to helping the students succeed academically, professionally, and in life.  The potential for this institution is massive.
cons: Resources are highly constrained and they can't seem to fins enough students or money to thrive.  Leadership is uneven.  High turnover.

pros: Your colleagues and students keep you motivated to work. Small teams with strong bonds. Great health benefits. Support underrepresented communities in Boston get access to higher education.
cons: Socioeconomic and cultural gap between professors/administrators and students.

review_title: We change lives here at BFIT.
pros: Diverse, compassionate, caring faculty and staff for underserved Boston students.
cons: Non-profit pay and no parking for commuter faculty and students.
